cat.gencat.ctti.canigo.arch.support.ole.word

Class WrapperWordView

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.context.support.ApplicationObjectSupport
      • org.springframework.web.context.support.WebApplicationObjectSupport
        • org.springframework.web.servlet.view.AbstractView
          • cat.gencat.ctti.canigo.arch.support.ole.word.WrapperWordView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.springframework.beans.factory.Aware, org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanNameAware, org.springframework.context.ApplicationContextAware, org.springframework.web.context.ServletContextAware, org.springframework.web.servlet.View

    public abstract class WrapperWordView
extends org.springframework.web.servlet.view.AbstractView
    Convenient superclass for Word document views.

    Properties:

    • url (optional): The url of an existing Word document to pick as a starting point. It is done without localization part nor the ".doc" extension.

    The file will be searched with locations in the following order:

    • [url]_[language]_[country].doc
    • [url]_[language].doc
    • [url].doc

    For working with the workbook in the subclass, see Jakarta's POI site

    As an example, you can try this snippet: 

                             protected void wrappedBuildWordDocument(Map model,
                                                                                                        WordDocument wordDocument,
                                                                                                        HttpServletRequest request,
                                                                                                        HttpServletResponse response)
                                        throws OleModuleException {
                                CharacterProperties props = new CharacterProperties();

                                for (int currentRow=0; currentRow<3; currentRow++) {
                                        props = new CharacterProperties();

                                        if (currentRow%2 == 0) {
                                                props.setBold(true);
                                        } else {
                                                props.setItalic(true);
                                        }

                                        String text = "canigo - id: "+currentRow+" size: "+(currentRow*10)+"\r\n";
                                        insertAfter(wordDocument, text, props);
                                }
                        }
    This class is similar to the WrapperExcelView class in usage style.
    Author:
    Eusebi Collell
    See Also:
    WrapperExcelView

      • wrappedBuildWordDocument

        protected abstract void wrappedBuildWordDocument(Map<String,Object> model,
                                                 org.apache.poi.hwpf.HWPFDocument wordDocument,
                                                 javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                                 javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
                                          throws OleModuleException
        Subclasses must implement this method to create an Word WordDocument document, given the model.
        Parameters:
        model - the model Map
        WordDocument - Word document
        request - in case we need locale etc. Shouldn't look at attributes.
        response - in case we need to set co java.util.List listText = _tpt.getTextPieces();
        Throws:
        OleModuleException
